description: This function generates a number line visualization for comparing decimal values. It is designed to support either 0.1 or 0.01 increments based on the range span, providing a visual aid for understanding decimal numbers and their relationships. The function is particularly useful in teaching concepts of decimal number comparison and arithmetic.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Decimal Comparison Number Line
stimulus_type_specification.description: This function can draw a number line with either 0.1 or 0.01 increments, depending on the range span. It accepts a range of decimal values as input, based on the DecimalComparisonNumberLine stimulus description class. The function ensures that the range span is either 1.0 or 0.1 and adjusts the increment and label formatting accordingly. The number line visualization is a powerful tool for teaching and learning decimal number comparison, understanding the concept of decimal increments, and practicing decimal arithmetic.

details: range_min: The minimum value of the range to be displayed on the number line
range_max: The maximum value of the range to be displayed on the number line
label_interval: The interval at which labels should be placed on the number line
The range span must be either 1.0 or 0.1
The label interval must be a positive integer
The range_min must be less than range_max
The function draws a horizontal number line with tick marks at regular intervals
Labels are placed at specified intervals, formatted to either 1 or 2 decimal places depending on the increment
The number line is extended slightly beyond the range for display purposes

educational_standards.description: Compare decimals to the thousandths on the number line.
